page.title: 09Local history, S of Buriton
page.content: Although today there are few people living in these downland areas there is much evidence to show that over the centuries there has been continuous occupation. The ancient trackway running W-E via Coulter's Dean was a much used thoroughfare, and crossing it from N-S traces remains of other tracks. Ploughing in any part reveals traces of occupation from the Iron Age onwards, but much ahs been destroyed by repeated cultivation. Principle sites are; Bronze Age barrows on Wardown, Iron Age pits, Romano-British settlement. Saxon spearheads and pottery have been found and there is evidence that this was the line of a Saxon road leading to Old Idsworth.
